reason: NO_RULE - insufficient evidence or no valid constraint found
notes: The evidence provided does not establish a direct semantic constraint between the fields 'csi-IM-ResourcesForInterference' and 'subbandSize'. The evidence discusses CSI reporting settings and conditions but does not relate these specific fields within the same IE.

meta.evidence: If the UE is configured with a CSI Reporting Setting for a bandwidth part with fewer than 24 PRBs, the CSI reporting setting is expected to have a wideband frequency-granularity, and, if applicable, the higher layer parameter codebookType is set to 'typel-SinglePanel'. The first subband size is given by N_{P R B}^{S B}-\left(N_{B I T P_{j}}^{S^{\text {stor }}} \bmod N_{P R B}^{S B}\right) and the last subband size given by \left(N_{B I T P_{j},}^{\text {start }}+N_{B I R P_{j},}^{\text {size }}\right) \bmod N_{P R B}^{S B} if If a UE is configured with semi-persistent CSI reporting, the UE shall report CSI when both CSI-IM and NZP CSI-RS resources are configured as periodic or semi-persistent. If a UE is configured with aperiodic CSI reporting, the UE shall report CSI when both CSI-IM and NZP CSI-RS resources are configured as periodic, semi-persistent or aperiodic. A UE configured with DCI format 0_1 or 0_2 does not expect to be triggered with multiple CSI reports with the same CSI-ReportConfigld.

full_api_response.notes: The evidence provided does not establish a direct semantic constraint between the fields 'csi-IM-ResourcesForInterference' and 'subbandSize'. The evidence discusses CSI reporting settings and conditions but does not relate these specific fields within the same IE.
